definition: endlessly interesting (idiom)/very witty
clever/wonderful
interesting/to interest
harsh and unreasonable/unexpected

horizontal/across/crosswise/horizontal stroke (in Chinese characters)/to place (sth) flat (on a surface)/to cross (a river, etc)/in a jumble/chaotic/(in fixed expressions) harsh and unreasonable/violent
to be born/to give birth/life/to grow/raw/uncooked/student

sentences.chinese: 意想不到的事情，總是妙趣橫生。

sentences.english: That joke is a classic; it really is funny.
sentences.chinese: 這個笑話確屬一流，真是妙趣橫生。

sentences.english: May you live in interesting times, May you find what you are looking for.
sentences.chinese: 願你生活的時代妙趣橫生，願你心中所想能美夢成真。

sentences.english: How to use the audience problem to make boring data interesting.
sentences.chinese: 如何利用聽衆的問題，將枯燥的數字變得妙趣橫生。

sentences.english: You can hardly expect scintillating conversation from a kid that age.
sentences.chinese: 你幾乎想不到那麼點兒的孩子會說出妙趣橫生的話來。

sentences.english: They are so cocky but also funny.
sentences.chinese: 他們如此高傲自大，但同時也妙趣橫生。

definition: terse/succinct
in different poses and with different expressions/in thousands of postures (idiom)
living spirit, living image (idiom); true to life/vivid and realistic
to provide food for thought (idiom)/thought-provoking
can be enjoyed by scholars and lay-people alike (idiom)
to feel deep veneration for sb (idiom)
to resemble nature itself/of the highest quality (idiom)
concise/compact/condensed
to explain a complicated subject matter in simple terms (idiom)/(of language) simple and easy to understand
leisurely and comfortable/relaxed
lit. slap the table and shout with praise (idiom); fig. wonderful!/amazing!/great!
cultured and refined (idiom); gentle and cultivated
(to gasp) with admiration
(of literature, art) distinct style/flavor/spirit/character
warms the heart and delights the eye (idiom)/pleasing/delightful
to start sth new or original (idiom); to break a new path/to break fresh ground
